PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Orbital mobility caused by close encounters with more than one massive asteroid
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Orbital diffusion caused by close encounters between a small asteroid and one of the most massive objects of the main belt, (1) Ceres, (2) Pallas, (4) Vesta, (7) Iris, and (324) Bamberga, was already known to be a mechanism able to change proper elements of asteroids in the orbital proximity of (1) Ceres and (4) Vesta (Carruba et al. 2003, 2007). Changes in semi-major axis, eccentricity and inclination caused by the long-term effect of close encounters with (4) Vesta can have contributed to the diffusion of some V-type objects outside the Vesta family, whose current orbits cannot be easily explained in terms of migration induced by other mechanisms, such as the Yarkovsky effect, interaction with mean-motion or secular resonances, or the interplay of both. The long-term effect of close encounters in previous works was not negligible, but of small entity, and only important in regions characterized by high collision probabilities with one of the most massive asteroids. Recently Laskar et al. (2011) showed that, when the five most massive asteroids are all included in simulations with all the other planets, surprisingly not only the orbits of the massive asteroids become more chaotic, but even the precision with which the orbital elements of the Earth are known with high accuracy is limited to 50 Myr. However, the effects on asteroid mobility of close encounters in the region of the five most massive asteroids have not yet be studied in detail when all five asteroids are considered. In this work we want to investigate if the mobility in proper elements of minor bodies is affected when the new integration scheme of Laskar (the entire Solar System plus the five most massive asteroids in the main belt) is considered.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Peculiar Euphrosyne
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: (31) Euphrosyne, com mais de 99% da massa total, й o corpo maior da sua famнlia de asteroides . Entre as famнlias de asteroides, o grupo de Euphrosyne й peculiar por causa da sua funзгo de distribuiзгo em tamanho (ou SFD) bastante inclinada, com uma significativa falta de corpos de tamanho mйdio-grande (8 < D < 12 km). A presente SFD da famнlia de Euphrosyne foi sugerida ser o resultado de um impacto tangencial, no qual somente os fragmentos menores, que chegaram mais longe, nгo caнram de volta em Euphrosyne. Esta famнlia й tambйm peculiar por razхes dinвmicas: perto do seu centro й cruzada pela ressonвncia secular linear nu6 = g-g6 , e tem a maior populaзгo (140 objetos) de asteroides em estados anti-alinhados da ressonвncia nu6 (ou asteroides de tipo Tina) do cinturгo principal. Neste trabalho investigamos a evoluзгo orbital de membros da famнlia, com uma atenзгo especial com respeito a interaзгo destes asteroides com a ressonвncia nu6. Por causa da configuraзгo orbital desta famнlia, os asteroides de tamanho grande e mйdio tendem a migrar para fora da famнlia mais rapidamente que os asteroides pequenos, que foram produzidos а distвncias maiores com respeito ao centro da famнlia. Como consequкncia, a SFD tende a tornar-se mais inclinada com o passar do tempo, com nъmeros cada vez menores de objetos de tamanho mйdio- grande. Estimamos que a atual SFD possa ser obtidas a partir de tнpicas funзхes de distribuiзхes iniciais em tempos-escadas de ~500 milhхes de anos, de acordo com estimativas da idade da famнlia obtida com mйtodos independentes.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: (31) Euphrosyne is the largest body of its namesake family and it contains more then 99% of the family mass. Among large asteroid families, the Euphrosyne group is peculiar because of its quite steep size frequency distribution, significantly depleted in large and medium-sized asteroids (8 < D < 12 km). The current steep size frequency distribution of the Euphrosyne family has been suggested to be the result of a grazing impact in which only the farthest, smallest members failed to accrete. The Euphrosyne family is however also very peculiar because of its dynamics: near its center it is crossed by the nu6 = g-g6 linear secular resonance, and it hosts the largest population (140 bodies) of asteroids in nu6 anti-aligned librating states (or Tina-like asteroids) in the main belt. In this work we investigated the orbital evolution of newly obtained members of the dynamical family, with an emphasis on its interaction with the nu6 resonance. Because of its unique resonant configuration, large and medium sized asteroids tend to migrate away from the family orbital region faster than small-sized objects, that were ejected further away from the family center. As a consequence, the size-frequency distribution of the Euphrosyne family becomes steeper in time, with a growing depletion in the number of the largest family members. We estimate that the current size-frequency distribution could be attained from a typical, initial size-frequency distribution in time-scales of 500 Myr, consistently with estimates of the family age obtained with other, independent, methods.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Peculiar Euphrosyne

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O Small Bodies Dynamics meeting й um congresso que visa a permitir a interaзгo de pesquisadores da бrea de dinвmica de corpos menores e a exposiзгo dos ъltimos resultados cientнficos nas бreas de dinвmica de asteroides, TNO, satйlites, poeira e anйis, e missхes espaciais. Acreditamos que seja um evento de grande importвncia pela ciкncia do estado de Sгo Paulo e Brasileira, pela novidade do evento, e, mais importante, pela qualidades dos trabalhos cientнficos dos pesquisadores convidados.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The SBD meeting intends to provide a new space for in-depth and stimulating discussions and talks on all aspects of minor bodies dynamics. PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Famнlias de Asteroides em ressonвncias seculares
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Mais de meio milhгo de asteroides sгo conhecidos no cinturгo principal e, devido аs novas descobertas, este nъmero aumenta constantemente. Entre a crescente populaзгo de objetos, alguns asteroides despertam interesse de estudo, por razхes dinвmicas ou taxonфmicas. Alguns asteroides fazem parte de famнlias, grupos de objetos prуximos nos espaзos dos elementos ou frequкncias prуprias, que supostamente tem origem comum no evento de colisгo que destruiu o corpo progenitor. Atualmente, mais de cem famнlias sгo conhecidas e algumas delas tкm como caracterнstica a interaзгo com ressonвncias de movimento mйdio e/ou secular. Como exemplos podem ser citadas as famнlias de Tina, Agnia e Padua. Na famнlia de Tina, os asteroides estгo em estado de libraзгo anti-alinhada devido а ressonвncia secular ${\nu}_6$ (Carruba and Morbidelli 2011). As famнlias de Agnia e Padua tкm a maior parte dos membros em libraзгo secular devido а ressonвncia secular nгo linear $z_1$ (Vokrouhlicky et al. 2006b, Carruba 2009). Tais famнlias apresentam configuraзхes orbitais bastante peculiares e a presenзa de quantidades preservadas das ressonвncias, o que torna possнvel obter mais informaзхes sobre o campo de velocidade de ejeзгo original dos objetos. Neste projeto nos propomos de investigar em detalhes as famнlias de asteroides que interagem com ressonвncias seculares que ainda nгo foram investigadas. Entre estas, o trabalho em andamento sobre a famнlia de Euphrosyne, ъnica por sua interaзгo com a ressonвncia ${\nu}_6$, que parece ter causado uma perda da populaзгo de asteroides de tamanho mйdio e grande, e as famнlias de Sylvia (interaзгo com a ressonвncia $z_1$), e de Erigone (interaзгo com a ressonвncia $z_2$), sгo уtimos candidatos para estudar em mais detalhes os processos de difusгo de famнlias interagindo com ressonвncias seculares.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: There are currently more than half a million asteroids in the main belt and the number is constantly increasing, because of observational surveys, accidental discoveries, etc. Among the growing population of objects, a few asteroid groups are of particular interests because of dynamical or taxonomical reasons. Some asteroids belong to families, groups of objects that cluster in domains of proper elements or frequencies, and that are supposed to share a common origin in the collisional event that shattered the parent body. Out of the more than a hundred currently known families, a few are characterized by their interaction with strong mean-motion or secular resonances, such as for instance the case of the Tina family, which is currently in states of anti-aligned libration of the ${\nu}_6$ secular resonance (Carruba and Morbidelli 2011). Or the Agnia and Padua families, a majority of whose members are in librating states of the $z_1$ non-linear secular resonance (Vokrouhlickэ et al. 2006b, Carruba 2009). Because of their peculiar orbital configuration, and of the preservation of conserved quantities of their resonances, additional information can be obtained on the original ejection velocity field of these families, not obtainable for other families not in such orbital configurations. In this project we aim to investigate in detail the dynamics of families that interact with secular resonances that were not yet investigated. Among these, the ongoing work on the Euphrosyne family, unique for its interaction with the ${\nu}_6$ secular resonance, that seems to have caused a depletion in the number of large- and medium-sized objects in this family, and the families of Sylvia (interaction with the $z_1$ resonance) and Erigone ((interaction with the $z_2$ resonance) are all excellent candidates for studying in details the diffusion processes of families interacting with secular resonances.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Limitaзхes sobre os campos de velocidades de ejeзгo terminais das famнlias de asteroides
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Famнlias de asteroides se formam por causa de colisхes entre corpos menores. A distribuiзгo orbital dos fragmentos, imediatamente depois da formaзгo da famнlia poderia providenciar informaзхes sobre as velocidades terminais de ejeзгo dos fragmentos. Infelizmente, as уrbitas dos asteroides evoluem por causa de vбrios efeitos, gravitacionais e nгo, como o efeito Yarkovsky, a difusгo caуtica em ressonвncias de movimento mйdio e seculares, e encontros prуximos com asteroides massivos. Fica, portanto, difнcil estimar as velocidades terminais de ejeзгo de membros de famнlias milhхes de anos depois da formaзгo da famнlia. Mйtodos para estimar campos de ejeзгo de velocidades terminais baseados na distribuiзгo atual dos semi-eixo maiores de membros de famнlias foram propostos no passado. Recentemente foi sugerido que, para algumas famнlias, a distribuiзгo das inclinaзхes poderia providenciar algumas informaзхes sobre a dispersгo original destes grupos. Neste trabalho, propomos estudar as famнlias cujas distribuiзхes leptokurticas da componente da velocidade perpendicular ao plano da уrbita do corpo progenitor ($v_W$) poderia ainda ter informaзхes sobre os campos de ejeзгo terminais destas famнlias. Obter limitaзхes independentes sobre estes valores poderia providenciar informaзхes importantes sobre a fнsica das colisхes e fornecer limitaзхes para modelos usados para reproduzir estes eventos, como os cуdigos SPH.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Asteroid families form as a result of large-scale collisions among main belt asteroids. The orbital distribution of fragments after a family-forming impact could inform us about their ejection velocities. Unfortunately, however, orbits dynamically evolve by a number of effects, including the Yarkovsky drift, chaotic diffusion, and gravitational encounters with massive asteroids, such that it is difficult to infer the ejection velocities eons after each family's formation. While methods to estimate the entity of the original ejection velocity field based on the current semi-major axis distribution of asteroid families have been proposed in the past, recently it has been suggested that, at least for some families, the inclination distribution could still provide clues about the original dispersion of some asteroid groups. In this work we propose to study the families whose leptokurtic current distribution in the component of the ejection velocity that is perpendicular to the orbital plane ($v_W$) suggest that information on the original ejection velocity field could still be available. Obtaining independent constraints on such values could provide precious clues about the physical mechanisms involved in the collisionary events that form asteroid families, and set constraints on models used to reproduce such events, such as the SPH codes.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Famнlias de asteroides jovens, explorando o limite entre as famнlias de fissгo e as famнlias collisionais.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Famнlias de asteroides sгo grupos de objetos que tem уrbitas similares. Elas podem ser produzidas por colisхes entre um projйtil e o corpo progenitor (famнlias colisionais), ou por causa da fissгo de um corpo secundбrio, ou por uma colisгo de baixa energia com um corpo primбrio rapidamente rotacionando (grupos de fissгo). Famнlias colisionais tendem a ser mais dispersas em semi-eixo maior e podem ser identificadas em espaзos de elementos prуprios. Grupos de fissгo tendem a ser mais compactos e sгo usualmente identificados em espaзos de elementos orbitais mйdios.Entre as famнlias de asteroides, apenas aquelas que foram criadas hб menos de ~7 milhхes de anos podem ser datadas usando o mйtodo da integraзгo das уrbitas no passado (BIM). Neste mйtodo as diferenзas entre as longitudes dos nodos e pericentros de membros das famнlias com respeito aos вngulos do corpo parente sгo simuladas no passado e sгo monitoradas para averiguar possнveis convergкncias mъtuas. Recentemente, um outro mйtodo baseado em encontros prуximos no passado entre o corpo progenitor e membros da famнlia foi proposto para datar famнlias jovens de asteroides. Quatro famнlias de asteroides, (3152) Jones,(7353) Kazuya, (108138) 2001 GB11, e (909) Ulla, foram tambйm recentemente identificadas como muito novas usando o BIM. Neste trabalho propomos usar o mйtodo de dataзгo de famнlias baseado em encontros prуximos para determinar as idades e os membros destas quatro famнlias. Algoritmos de aprendizagem de mбquina serгo aplicados para objetivamente averiguar a presenзa de possнveis sub-famнlias e para datar estes grupos. Resultados preliminares para a famнlia de (108138) 2001 GB11 mostram que й possнvel encontrar grupos de fissгo dentro de famнlias colisionais, e que esta ocorrкncia poderia ser observada em outras famнlias, como aquela de (3152) Jones. Famнlias "mistas", onde eventos colisionais e de fissгo ocorreram em curtos intervalos de tempo, poderiam ser mais comuns do que anteriormente pensado.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Asteroid families are groups of objects that have similar orbits. They can be produced as the result of a collision between a projectile and the family parent body (collisional families), or because of the fission of a secondary body or of a low-energy impact on a rapidly rotating primary (fission clusters). Collisional families tend to be more dispersed in semi-major axis and they are usually identified in domains of proper elements. Fission clusters tend to be more compact and they are usually identified in mean-orbital elements domains. Among asteroid families, those that were created less than ~7 Myr ago can be dated with more precision using the Backward Integration Method (BIM), where the differences of the longitudes of nodes and pericenter of family members with respect to the parent body angles are tracked down in the past to check for mutual convergences. Recently, another approach based on close encounters between the alleged parent body and clones of family members drifting into the past has also been proposed to date young asteroid families. Four asteroid families, those of (3152) Jones, (7353) Kazuya, (108138) 2001 GB11, and (909) Ulla, were also recently identified as very young using BIM. In this work we propose to use the method of family dating based on past close encounters to determine these four families ages and membership. Machine-learning technique will also be used on the results to objectively check for sub-families inside the larger group and for dating these sub-groups. Preliminary results for the (108138) 2001 GB11 family show that it is possible to find fission clusters inside collisional groups, and that this occurrence may appear in other asteroid families, such as that of Jones. ``Mixed'' asteroid families where fission and collisional event occurred in short time intervals may be, therefore, more common than previously thought.
